page.title: 18 Ragley Hall - Architecture
page.content: Ragley Hall is a Stately Home near Alcester.Above the entrance doorway there is a triangular section supported by pillars.Underneath the pillars is a platform of stone about 10 feet high.There are two flights of steps leading onto the platform from the floor. There are many windows set in the front of Ragley Hall which are latticed.The building is split into three sections with the centre section,the longest,set back from the two other sections. Inside the house, most of the rooms have high ceilings.The largest room is the Great Hall where all the celebrations were held.It has a chequered floor and baroque decoration. .There is a library and study which contains old books.Most rooms have a fireplace and carved lintels.
